title: Software Platform Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen Silicon
description:
Software Platform Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen Silicon

Join or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the Software Platform Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen Silicon role at Canonical

Software Platform Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen Silicon

1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Software Platform Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen Silicon role at Canonical

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
We are hiring engineering managers who are passionate about operational systems, open source technologies and cutting-edge hardware to lead engineering teams to enable and optimize Ubuntu for the latest x86, ARM, RISC-V, s390x and POWER systems.
We partner with the world's leading silicon vendors to optimise Ubuntu on their latest platforms. We integrate next-generation features and performance enhancements in Ubuntu while also ensuring a common operating experience for their users.
Engineering Managers should be outstanding developers themselves. They should be completely at home reviewing a patch or a software design spec. You will be expected to drive healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisations as well as lead your team to deliver high-quality design and code.
An Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team and product from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role.
You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
Location: This is a globally remote role. We have open positions in every time zone.
What your day will look like

  • Lead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to senior
  • Oversee commercial engagements and support timely delivery on agreed project milestones
  • Participate as technical lead on complex customer engagements involving complete system architectures
  • Implement disciplined engineering processes
  • Integrate and maintain platform-oriented software stacks
  • Optimize Ubuntu for latest hardware platforms
  • Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
  • Contribute to code reviews and technical documentation
  • Be an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leaders
What we are looking for in you
  • Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
  • Fluency in C, C++, and Python
  • Experience with Linux and operational systems software (e.g. kernel or user space)
  • Experience with Debian/Ubuntu or other distro packaging
  • Experience leading software engineering teams
  • Professional written and spoken English
  • Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
  • Thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
  • Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long
Nice-to-have skills
  • Experience working with open source communities and licenses
  • Computer architecture knowledge of x86, ARM, RISC-V or s390x
  • Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation
  • Experience working with customers
  • Experience with board bring up and validation
  • Experience with Linux virtualization, networking or graphics stacks
  • Experience with one or more of the follow
  • Experience with Docker/OCI containers/K8s
  • ing technologies: confidential computing, RDMA, Infiniband and high performance computing.
  • Performance engineering, benchmarking and profiling
What we offer you
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: GERENTE BANQUETES
description:
Descrição da empresa

No Fairmont Rio de Janeiro Copacabana você viverá uma experiência única e incomparável durante sua hospedagem em Copacabana, seja a passeio ou a trabalho. Aproveite os serviços de spa, sauna, massagem e salão de beleza do nosso Fairmont SPA e a piscina com borda infinita para revitalizar as energias. O hotel de luxo conta também com café, bar com mixologia e um delicioso restaurante especializado em frutos do mar, além de salas para reuniões e eventos e uma bela vista panorâmica do Rio de Janeiro.

O hotel 5 estrelas está situado na Avenida Atlântica, próximo às praias de Copacabana e Ipanema, além do Recanto do Museu e do Forte de Copacabana, que estão a 8 minutos a pé do hotel. Conheça os sabores dos deliciosos restaurantes e bares de Copacabana enquanto aprecia cada momento da viagem em um dos bairros mais famosos da zona sul do Rio de Janeiro, conhecido por suas ruas boêmias e poéticas, que até hoje servem de inspiração para os mais diversos artistas criarem suas músicas, livros e poesias.

Na hora de decidir o que fazer no Rio de Janeiro, lembre-se de incluir no roteiro o Museu do Amanhã, a lagoa Rodrigo de Freitas e o Museu de Arte Moderna. Usufrua de toda a riqueza e graciosidade da região e eternize a cidade maravilhosa dentro de você!

Descrição do emprego

This position is responsible for the organization, planning and directing of overall daily banquet event operation and administration of the department and be responsible and accountable for its profitability and revenue generation.

Qualificações

Knowledge and Experience

  1. Diploma in Hospitality Management/Food & Beverage preferred
  2. Additional certification(s) in Food & Beverage will be an advantage
  3. Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in a similar capacity
  4. Excellent reading, writing and oral proficiency in English language
  5. Ability to speak other languages and basic understanding of local languages will be an advantage
  6. Working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, & PowerPoint

Competencies

  1. Strong leadership, interpersonal and training skills
  2. Good communication and customer contact skills
  3. Service oriented with an eye for details
  4. Ability to work well in stressful & high-pressure situations
  5. A team player & builder
  6. A motivator & self-starter

description:

Supervisão de Equipes:

Liderar e motivar a equipe de atendimento, composta por controladores de chamados e analistas.

Análise e Monitoramento:

Monitorar a fila de chamados de clientes, garantindo a rápida resolução de problemas e a satisfação do cliente.

Relatórios de Desempenho:

Desenvolver, manter e analisar relatórios detalhados sobre indicadores de qualidade, desempenho da equipe, produtividade e qualidade de atendimento. Apresentar relatórios mensais de desempenho do departamento para a diretoria e clientes.

Verificação de Sistemas:

Avaliar o desempenho dos sistemas de monitoramento de atendimento ao cliente e recursos técnicos instalados, identificando melhorias necessárias. Colaborar com a equipe de TI para garantir o funcionamento adequado e atualizações.

Atendimento ao Cliente:

KPIs e Indicadores de Qualidade:

Desenvolver e acompanhar relatórios de indicadores de qualidade e desempenho, implementando ações corretivas e preventivas com base na análise.

Integração e Alinhamento Interno:

Promover integração com áreas internas como TI, Qualidade e Recursos Humanos, visando melhorias contínuas nos processos e na qualidade de atendimento.

Engajamento e Motivação:

Demonstrar habilidades de relacionamento, comunicação e engajamento, mantendo a equipe motivada. Implementar iniciativas para o bem-estar e satisfação dos funcionários.

Melhoria de Processos:

Analisar e propor melhorias com base nos indicadores e feedbacks, buscando otimizar operações e aumentar eficiência.

Planejamento Estratégico:

title: Agente de Agendamento
description:
Você tem excelente comunicação e paixão por atender clientes? Quer fazer parte de uma equipe que valoriza a eficiência e a cordialidade? O Vita Check-up está procurando por você!

Sobre a Vaga:

Estamos em busca de uma Agente de Agendamento para se juntar à nossa equipe. Sua principal missão será garantir que nossos clientes executivos tenham uma experiência fluida e eficiente ao agendar seus check-ups.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Agendamento Ativo: Atendimentos a executivos das empresas para agendar seu check-up.
  • Agendamento Passivo: Atender clientes que entram em contato por telefone, e-mail ou WhatsApp.
  • Autorização de Operadoras: Lidar com operadoras para obter autorizações via WhatsApp, e-mail, telefone e plataformas específicas.
  • Reuniões de Kick Off: Participar de reuniões iniciais com novas empresas-clientes.
  • Gerenciamento de Dados: Alimentar o sistema de agendamento com informações precisas, cadastrar e/ou confirmar visitas.
  • Agendamento de Clientes Particulares: Gerenciar agendamentos de vendas realizadas pelas comerciais PF.
  • Gestão Financeira: Abrir Ordens de Serviço no sistema financeiro e realizar relatórios semanais para empresas-clientes, informando o status dos agendamentos.

Perfil do Candidato:

  • Faixa Etária: 22 a 50 anos
  • Características Principais: Postura cordial e educada, experiência com envio de e-mails e sistemas de cadastro/agendamento, organização, proatividade, excelente escrita e dicção.
  • Formação: Curso de atendimento ao cliente, ou formação em Letras, Comunicação e correlatas.
  • Habilidades Pessoais: Comunicativa, ótima locução verbal, simpática, organizada, assídua, paciente, empática, colaborativa.
  • Habilidades Técnicas: Nível intermediário em Pacote Office, familiaridade com plataformas de automações de e-mails e chatbot.
  • Experiência Profissional: Pelo menos 1 ano de experiência com agendamento.

Por Que Juntar-se a Nós?

Há mais de 25 anos realizando diagnósticos na área de saúde.

O Vita Check-up é um dos principais centros de check-up de saúde do país e nasceu para contribuir que as pessoas conheçam a sua saúde e se conscientizem da importância das ações preventivas podendo viver mais e melhor. Nossa missão é proporcionar uma experiência única na realização de check-up com alta qualidade, empatia, inovação e atendimento humano.

Oferecemos um ambiente dinâmico, onde você poderá desenvolver suas habilidades e crescer na sua carreira. Venha fazer parte de uma equipe dedicada a transformar leads em oportunidades e resultados concretos com Excelência, Seriedade e Integridade!

Se você está pronto(a) para encarar esse desafio e deseja fazer a diferença, envie seu currículo agora e faça parte do nosso time vencedor!

  2. Elaborar os Procedimentos Executivos (PEs) e Estudos de Viabilidade (EVs);
  3. Elaborar as Instruções de Trabalho da Equipe de Engenharia;
  4. Elaborar os planos de carregamento e estudos de armazenamento de PLSVs;
  5. Trabalhar junto à equipe de Desenhistas Técnicos na elaboração dos desenhos de manobras, estudos e arranjos submarinos;
  6. Entregar o PE/EV dentro do prazo estabelecido para a verificação;
  7. Oferecer suporte técnico às equipes offshore e onshore e ao Cliente;
  8. Apoiar o Engenheiro Líder de Projetos na verificação de procedimentos;
  9. Outras responsabilidades por delegação do supervisor.

Experiências e/ou Qualificações:

  1. Formação em Engenharia;
  2. Experiência em O&G será um diferencial;
  3. Habilidades com análise e interpretação de desenhos técnicos;
  4. Relatórios e Planilhas;
  5. Inglês Intermediário/Avançado.

Regime de contratação:

Salário e Benefícios:

• Serão informados durante a entrevista.

A Seagems é uma empresa brasileira e um dos principais players do mercado nacional de óleo e gás, com uma frota de seis navios de serviços submarinos e mais de 1000 profissionais. Temos sede no Rio de Janeiro e em Rio das Ostras, mas também marcamos presença em Duque de Caxias e Vitória. Há ainda um escritório fora do Brasil, em Viena, na Áustria.

Certificada como GPTW, a Seagems tem orgulho em ser uma empresa formadora e transformadora. Por isso, criou seu próprio centro de treinamentos e programa de desenvolvimento de carreira. Nossas embarcações são ricas em cultura e aprendizado.

A companhia procura sempre aproximar pessoas com diferentes experiências, formações e nacionalidades. Cultivando diversidade, enormes sonhos e desafios, continua sempre querendo alcançar mais. Acreditamos na inclusão, e por isso, temos o compromisso de fazer um processo de recrutamento que garanta oportunidades iguais para todos, independentemente de etnia, gênero, deficiência, orientação sexual, identidade de gênero ou religião.

title: Agente de Agendamento
description:
Você tem excelente comunicação e paixão por atender clientes? Quer fazer parte de uma equipe que valoriza a eficiência e a cordialidade? O Vita Check-up está procurando por você!

Sobre a Vaga:

Estamos em busca de uma Agente de Agendamento para se juntar à nossa equipe. Sua principal missão será garantir que nossos clientes executivos tenham uma experiência fluida e eficiente ao agendar seus check-ups.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Agendamento Ativo: Atendimentos a executivos das empresas para agendar seu check-up.
  • Agendamento Passivo: Atender clientes que entram em contato por telefone, e-mail ou WhatsApp.
  • Autorização de Operadoras: Lidar com operadoras para obter autorizações via WhatsApp, e-mail, telefone e plataformas específicas.
  • Reuniões de Kick Off: Participar de reuniões iniciais com novas empresas-clientes.
  • Gerenciamento de Dados: Alimentar o sistema de agendamento com informações precisas, cadastrar e/ou confirmar visitas.
  • Agendamento de Clientes Particulares: Gerenciar agendamentos de vendas realizadas pelas comerciais PF.
  • Gestão Financeira: Abrir Ordens de Serviço no sistema financeiro e realizar relatórios semanais para empresas-clientes, informando o status dos agendamentos.

Perfil do Candidato:

  • Faixa Etária: 22 a 50 anos
  • Características Principais: Postura cordial e educada, experiência com envio de e-mails e sistemas de cadastro/agendamento, organização, proatividade, excelente escrita e dicção.
  • Formação: Curso de atendimento ao cliente, ou formação em Letras, Comunicação e correlatas.
  • Habilidades Pessoais: Comunicativa, ótima locução verbal, simpática, organizada, assídua, paciente, empática, colaborativa.
  • Habilidades Técnicas: Nível intermediário em Pacote Office, familiaridade com plataformas de automações de e-mails e chatbot.
  • Experiência Profissional: Pelo menos 1 ano de experiência com agendamento.

Por Que Juntar-se a Nós?

Há mais de 25 anos realizando diagnósticos na área de saúde.

O Vita Check-up é um dos principais centros de check-up de saúde do país e nasceu para contribuir que as pessoas conheçam a sua saúde e se conscientizem da importância das ações preventivas podendo viver mais e melhor. Nossa missão é proporcionar uma experiência única na realização de check-up com alta qualidade, empatia, inovação e atendimento humano.

Oferecemos um ambiente dinâmico, onde você poderá desenvolver suas habilidades e crescer na sua carreira. Venha fazer parte de uma equipe dedicada a transformar leads em oportunidades e resultados concretos com Excelência, Seriedade e Integridade!

Se você está pronto(a) para encarar esse desafio e deseja fazer a diferença, envie seu currículo agora e faça parte do nosso time vencedor!

A Share People Hub em parceria com organização filantrópica que apoia o enfretamento das mudanças climáticas no Brasil, buscam por Especialista II em Energia, para atuação híbrida no Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo e Distrito Federal e para outros estados modelo remoto.


Como é o dia a dia de um Especialista II em Energia:

  • O profissional executará as atividades de articulação e desenvolvimento de projetos e eventos com parceiros internacionais, elaboração de artigos, relatórios e estudos para apoiar a transição energética e industrial brasileira no âmbito internacional, visando prospectar parceiros/doadores que apoiam a causa;
  • Atuar frente às estratégias de diplomacia energética e industrial para promover a indústria nacional de baixo carbono, no cenário global;
  • Produzir análises e apresentações, técnicas e econômicas, da estrutura da demanda e geração de energia e produtos de baixo carbono no Brasil e do mundo, incluindo atores e tecnologias envolvidas;
  • Participar presencial e remotamente dos eventos internacionais, de conteúdo técnico e/ou político e/ou econômico, sobre emissões de GEE (gases efeito estufa) nas gerações de energia e em atividades industriais, visando apresentar propostas de expansão de renováveis e redução das emissões de gases;
  • Prospectar e identificar novos parceiros, doadores e outros atores da sociedade civil e governamental, bem como, acompanhar as doações do Eixo Programático da instituição;

É preciso ter:

  • Experiência com temas de energia, indústria e projetos em organizações internacionais;
  • Desejável experiência com temas diplomáticos em Instituições, Embaixadas ou Empresas sob temas climáticos;
  • Ensino superior em áreas relacionadas ao campo de Relações Internacionais, Energia, Direito, Engenharia e/ou indústria;
  • Desejável pós-graduação ou especialização;
  • Inglês fluente e espanhol desejável.

title: Head of Finance
description:
Join to apply for the Head of Finance role at FIFA Women's World Cup

Join to apply for the Head of Finance role at FIFA Women's World Cup

Description
FIFA27 will be established as the Local FIFA Subsidiary in Brazil, to work together with FIFA HQ in Zurich and globally, to deliver the biggest women’s sporting event in the world, the FIFA Women’s World Cup 2027 (“FWWC2027”).

Department: Finance

Location: Remote

Description
FIFA27 will be established as the Local FIFA Subsidiary in Brazil, to work together with FIFA HQ in Zurich and globally, to deliver the biggest women’s sporting event in the world, the FIFA Women’s World Cup 2027 (“FWWC2027”).
This role will initially be a temporary freelance position supporting the preparation phase for the FWWC2027, transitioning to a fixed-term contract position once the FIFA27 local subsidiary is established in Brazil.
THE POSITION
Under the responsibility of the Tournament Director and in collaboration with the FIFA Finance division, the Head of Finance will contribute to the development of the financial strategy, will oversee the financial operations of the new entity and will manage the dedicated finance team.
The finance department of the entities will include the following functions: Accounting, Controlling, Treasury, Tax, Insurance and Procurement.
Key Responsibilities
Initial Phase
  • Build and lead a Finance Team including Accounting, Controlling, and Procurement.
  • Establish financial functions, open bank accounts, and implement FIFA Financial tools.
  • Review and implement FIFA policies and procedures to ensure compliance and transparency.
  • Perform basic accounting and payroll tasks; develop initial budget forecasts.
  • Prepare financial reports as required by FIFA and entity management.
  • Support legal entity set-up and cooperation with third parties and authorities.
Planning & Operating Phase
  • Lead all finance functions (Accounting, Controlling, Procurement) for FIFA Subsidiary in Brazil.
  • Oversee tax, insurance, and financial compliance with IFRS and FIFA principles.
  • Act as a business partner to guide decision-making and manage financial risks.
  • Coordinate with FIFA on budgeting, consolidation, and reporting requirements.
  • Establish relations with senior management, external partners, and stakeholders.
  • Analyze cash flow, expenditures, and revenues; produce error-free accounting reports.
  • Oversee tax audits, tax returns, GST returns, and improve accounting processes.
  • Support FIFA in overall tournament financial planning.
  • Implement procurement processes; assist with insurance coverage implementation.
  • Manage, supervise, and motivate the Finance team; contribute to daily financial tasks as needed.
YOUR PROFILE

title: Gestor Gastronômico
description:
No Supermercado Zona Sul, acreditamos que o nosso sucesso está diretamente ligado ao empenho e dedicação de cada membro da nossa equipe. Trabalhar conosco não é apenas ocupar uma vaga, mas sim, integrar uma família que valoriza o respeito, a cooperação e o crescimento profissional.

Se você é uma pessoa proativa, dedicada e quer fazer parte de uma empresa que reconhece e valoriza o esforço, então essa é a sua chance! Junte-se a nós e ajude a construir um ambiente de trabalho onde cada conquista é celebrada e cada desafio é uma oportunidade para aprender e crescer.

Responsabilidades:

  1. Gestão gastronômica da loja;
  2. Identificar oportunidades comerciais, seja através de novos produtos ou criando sinergia entre os produtos já existentes;
  3. Inovar na apresentação e abordagem;
  4. Difundir conhecimento gastronômico entre colaboradores e clientes, agregando valor aos produtos;
  5. Disseminar a cultura da redução do desperdício e promover o reaproveitamento de produtos;

Requisitos:

  • Ensino Superior Completo em Gastronomia ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência em restaurantes, cozinhas, com atuação na criação de novos pratos e menus (Chefe de Cozinha);
  • Experiência em Gestão de Pessoas;
  • Paixão por Gastronomia!

Disponibilidade para trabalhar nas lojas na Zona Sul ou Zona Oeste do Rio de Janeiro.

Benefícios:

  • Salário compatível com o mercado;
  • Vale Transporte;
  • Refeição no local;
  • Plano de Saúde;
  • Plano Odontológico;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Participação nos Resultados;
  • Desconto em produtos da empresa.

Plano de Saúde e Odontológico, Alimentação no Local.

Sobre Supermercados Zona Sul

Fundado em 04 de julho de 1959, em Ipanema, Rio de Janeiro, o Zona Sul nasceu do sonho de criar um negócio diferenciado, focado em superar as expectativas dos clientes através de uma experiência de compra única e uma ampla oferta de soluções, gerando valor para acionistas, colaboradores e fornecedores, sempre guiado por ética, inovação, agilidade, humildade, compromisso com os clientes, atitude, credibilidade, eficiência e responsabilidade socioambiental.

Atualmente, com faturamento anual superior a 3 bilhões de reais e sendo uma das 400 maiores empresas do Brasil, o Zona Sul possui 46 lojas em diferentes regiões do Rio de Janeiro, incluindo unidades na Barra da Tijuca, Recreio e uma na cidade de Angra dos Reis, além do modelo de atacarejo Mega Box e do pioneiro e-commerce Zona Sul.

Na área de recursos humanos, a empresa gera mais de 6.500 empregos diretos e mais de 20.000 indiretos, valorizando seu maior ativo: as pessoas.

    Support & assist Senior Drilling Engineer with all aspects of drilling engineering works for successful, cost effective and safe implementation of COMPANY exploration wells.

  • Ensure that all well documentation is organized during and at the end of drilling operations.

    • Familiar floater drilling rig units;

title: Senior Manager Accounting (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
Senior Manager Accounting (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)

Join to apply for the Senior Manager Accounting (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided) role at Agoda .

About Agoda: Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel: We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn, and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding, and happiness. We are a skillful, driven, and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team: Agoda has expanded its reach globally and enhanced its travel products. A key driver of this success is the Agoda Finance team, which maintains daily financial operations while exploring future opportunities. We balance risk management with innovation and growth, serving as a strategic partner within the company. Our culture emphasizes experimentation and data analysis, providing insights to support sustainable and scalable expansion. We also focus on career development, with clear tracks and goals for each team member.

The Opportunity: This role focuses on exploring accounting, tax, and finance knowledge across multiple countries. You will work with accounting agencies and auditors, coordinate with Booking Holdings and other brands, and gain exposure to international accounting and finance practices. You will learn about our products, workflows, and contribute to projects such as implementing new payment methods, designing data flows, and supporting new initiatives.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

  • Provide reports and analyze financial performance to support management decisions.
  • Motivate and develop the management accounting team, encouraging responsibility and career growth.
  • Collaborate with other finance managers to achieve department goals.
  • Guide staff on non-routine reporting transactions.
  • Coordinate with operational units to ensure timely, accurate financial data for internal and external reporting.

Accounting Controls:

  • Maintain internal controls in compliance with policies, anti-corruption measures, and SOX requirements.
  • Review reconciliations of significant accounts, report exceptions to management.
  • Research and interpret accounting policies to support operational issues.

Tax:

  • Understand key concepts of tax filings in jurisdictions where the company operates.
  • Provide accurate information for tax compliance locally and internationally.

Others:

  • Work with stakeholders to understand and assess the impact of initiatives.
  • Lead financial reporting and operational functions for projects and initiatives.
  • Identify opportunities for process and technology improvements.
  • Handle ad-hoc requests and issues.
  • Provide oversight, training, and coaching to team members.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Accounting or Finance.
  • At least 12 years of experience in finance operations, risk control, or finance management.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and analytical skills.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability.
  • Experience in project management and leadership.
  • Proficiency in English, Excel, and presentation tools.
  • Knowledge of local/US GAAP and internal controls.

It’s Great If You Have:

  • CPA and audit background.
  • Knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Agoda values diversity and is committed to an inclusive environment. Employment is based on merit and qualifications. We do not accept third-party resumes and are not responsible for fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: GESTOR DE TRÁFEGO PLENO - HOME OFFICE
description:
Descrição da Vaga:
Procuramos um Gestor de Tráfego Pago para integrar a nossa equipe, atuando no gerenciamento e otimização de campanhas publicitárias digitais para o setor de construção nos Estados Unidos. O profissional será responsável por criar, executar e monitorar campanhas nas plataformas Meta Ads e Google Ads, garantindo resultados estratégicos alinhados aos objetivos dos clientes.

Missão da Empresa:
Transformar empresas de brasileiros no setor de construção nos Estados Unidos em grandes negócios. Nosso trabalho é estruturado com uma visão de sócio, capacitando nossos clientes para captarem e fecharem contratos com independência, enquanto superam barreiras culturais e linguísticas. Oferecemos soluções completas e inovadoras, sempre com o compromisso de impactar positivamente suas vidas e negócios.

Valores:

  • Compromisso com a Excelência : Superar expectativas em todas as entregas.
  • Transparência e Integridade : Conduzimos negócios com ética e honestidade.
  • Foco no Cliente : Colaborar estreitamente para alcançar metas e superar desafios.
  • Inovação Contínua : Investimos em tecnologias e soluções inovadoras para oferecer o melhor aos nossos clientes.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Gerenciar campanhas de tráfego pago desde a concepção até a execução final.
  • Selecionar públicos e segmentações alinhados à persona definida.
  • Analisar dados básicos para identificar oportunidades de otimização de campanhas.
  • Gerir múltiplas campanhas simultaneamente, priorizando tarefas e prazos.
  • Gerenciar orçamentos publicitários e assegurar a entrega dentro das expectativas financeiras e temporais.
  • Emitir relatórios mensais com análises detalhadas de resultados.
  • Participar de reuniões de alinhamento interno e com clientes, garantindo a clareza das estratégias e resultados.
  • Fornecer suporte ativo em grupos de WhatsApp, acompanhando demandas e alinhando entregas.

Requisitos Técnicos:

  • Domínio das plataformas Meta Ads e Google Ads .
  • Conhecimento em Google Meu Negócio .
  • Boa escrita e visão estratégica.
  • Visão analítica (desejável).
  • Conhecimento básico/médio em inglês (para campanhas realizadas em inglês).

Competências Comportamentais:

  • Proatividade e capacidade de resolver problemas.
  • Boa comunicação e habilidade de trabalho em equipe.
  • Gestão de tempo e organização, especialmente em regime de home office.
  • Adaptabilidade para mudanças de plataforma e ferramentas.
  • Foco em resultados e busca constante por soluções para melhorar campanhas e entregar resultados significativos aos clientes.

MODALIDADE: PJ

FORMATO: HOME OFFICE

CARGA HORÁRIA: COMERCIAL À COMBINAR

title: Gestor de clínica
description:
Sobre a Habitat

A Habitat Consultórios é uma plataforma onde consultórios, clínicas e coworking’s oferecem espaços e serviços e locais de atendimento para profissionais de saúde. Desenvolvemos ecossistemas de saúde integrados com processos bem definidos, gestão de pessoas, trazendo dados e inteligência para a tomada de decisão e desenvolvimento.

Somos uma empresa que tem 4 anos de atuação no mercado, vindo de uma experiência em gerenciamento de clínica desde o ano 2000. Nossa missão é ser o Habitat físico de profissionais para saúde e seus pacientes. Um local de experimentação, adaptação e inovação, um ambiente de cultura compartilhada, inteligência, humanização e empreendedorismo.

Perfil de vaga de gerente de consultório

Estamos procurando um profissional flexível e versátil com experiência em gestão de clínicas de saúde , com foco em planejamento estratégico e financeiro que será responsável pela gestão do dia a dia das unidades, relacionamento com os locatários, comunicação ativa e passiva, construção e venda de serviços; gestor de canais de vendas, gerenciar o orçamento, criação e definição de processos de atendimento, processos de reembolso.

Nesta função, você conseguirá:

  1. Estratégia: trabalhar junto aos proprietários e time de atendimento, além de time de desenvolvimento e Atendimento ao cliente para ajudar a projetar os processos, ações e metas para alcançá-los, construindo um plano realista com entregas claras, métricas de sucesso e marcos/pontos de verificação. Construirá a meta, a estratégia e a estrutura de otimização.
  2. Liderar: você terá recursos dedicados para desenvolver cada uma das duas áreas estratégicas sob sua responsabilidade, que dependerão de você para orientação, tomada de decisão e solução criativa de problemas.
  3. Entrega: nas unidades físicas, fazemos as coisas acontecerem. Você verá imediatamente o impacto de suas escolhas e esforços e poderá usá-los para continuar otimizando ainda mais nossos processos e sistemas.

Este papel é bom para você se você:

  1. Pode quantificar claramente o impacto de suas ações: com tanto a fazer, precisamos ser mestres em priorização.
  2. Seja um especialista em gerenciamento de processos/projetos: você sabe como mapear tudo o que fazemos, identificar o custo e o valor dessas atividades, encontrar melhores maneiras de alcançar o mesmo resultado e construir um plano abrangente e gradual para nos levar até lá.
  3. Você é inquieto e quer causar impacto: essa função requer a capacidade de reunir apoio e conduzir os planos até a conclusão, mesmo diante de prioridades conflitantes.

O que você precisa para ter sucesso:

  • Graduação em Administração, Gestão Hospitalar, Gestão de Negócios ou áreas correlatas;

title: Senior Hardware Engineer (PCB & RF Design)
description:
Senior Hardware Engineer (PCB & RF Design)

2 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join Our Team

Oowlish, one of Latin America's rapidly expanding software development companies, is seeking experienced technology professionals to enhance our diverse and vibrant team. As a valued member of Oowlish, you will collaborate with premier clients from the United States and Europe, contributing to pioneering digital solutions. Our commitment to creating a nurturing work environment is recognized by our certification as a Great Place to Work, where you will have opportunities for professional development, growth, and a chance to make a significant international impact. We offer the convenience of remote work, allowing you to craft a work-life balance that suits your personal and professional needs. We're looking for candidates who are passionate about technology, proficient in English, and excited to engage in remote collaboration for a worldwide presence.

About The Role

We seek a Senior Hardware Engineer to join our team and lead the development of embedded hardware solutions for wearables and IoT devices . This role will focus on PCB design, RF performance optimization, and power efficiency , ensuring our products meet industry standards and certification requirements. You will work closely with firmware, product, and software development teams to drive innovation and deliver high-quality hardware solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop multi-layer (4+) PCB layouts for wearable and IoT embedded systems, ensuring high-speed signal integrity and power distribution.
  • Develop and optimize RF board designs, ensuring compliance with FCC, CE, and other regulatory certifications.
  • Troubleshoot and enhance hardware performance, including signal integrity, EMI mitigation, and power management.
  • Collaborate with firmware engineers to validate hardware functionality and improve system-level performance.
  • Work with vendors and manufacturers to ensure successful production, quality control, and scalability of hardware components.
Must-Have

  • 5+ years of experience in PCB design (4+ layers) with a deep understanding of high-speed signal integrity & power distribution.
  • Proven experience in RF board design for wearables, IoT, or low-power embedded systems.
  • Hands-on experience developing products that have successfully passed FCC/CE certifications.
Nice To Have

  • Experience using Vector Network Analyzers (VNAs) to tune antennas.
  • Ability to write firmware for testing RF components and sensors.
  • Knowledge of wireless communication protocols: WiFi, Bluetooth, Cellular, UWB, GNSS.
  • Experience in RTOS-based embedded systems and power-optimized firmware development.
  • Familiarity with BLE & WiFi at the firmware level.
  • Experience with Python for data analysis & motion-based algorithms in testing/validation.
  • Ability to perform minor modifications on PCBs with small SMD components (0402, 0.5mm pitch or smaller).
Benefits & Perks

  • Home office
  • Flexible Hours
  • Competitive compensation based on experience
  • Career plans to allow for extensive growth in the company
  • International Projects
  • Oowlish English Program (Technical and Conversational)

  • Wedding gift
  • Pet adoption incentive
  • New baby Oowl bonus
  • Back to School bonus
  • Streaming Subscription
  • PTO Bonus
  • Games and Competitions
  • Enjoy your national Holidays

title: Director of Engineering - Growth
description:
The Growth organization at SuperBet ensures that every user has their ideal customer experience with optimized economics. This organization includes key initiatives such as personalization foundations, new player experiences, viral acquisition, and more.

As an experimentation-driven organization, the Director of Engineering of the Growth Organization will be at the cutting-edge of New Product Development for Superbet, ensuring that every user has the optimal experience across our products.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Partnering to define the strategy and vision of the Growth organization, building new teams to achieve it, and growing the existing teams.
  • Driving Growth engineering from an idea to a fully functioning organization.
  • Leading by example as an Experimentation and Outcome-driven organization.
  • Landing organizational impact for SuperBet by influencing strategy, driving business decisions, and building relationships with partners and stakeholders to drive outcomes (Product, Marketing, Design, Commercial, Leadership).
  • Partnering with teams across the company to land improvements on their products.
  • Building, supporting, and driving an organization made up of multiple teams of engineers including frontend, backend, fullstack, data scientists, and data engineers.
  • Providing people management support and direction to your managers and teams in the form of hiring, coaching, support, feedback, performance management, and reviews.
  • Owning technical strategy and direction for your teams by handling ambiguity, building/driving roadmaps, ensuring engineering excellence, setting goals, and measuring impact.

What we’re looking for:

  • Deep product knowledge and experience driving improvements to some or all portions of the user journey of a product.
  • Knowledge of experimentation techniques, frameworks, and evaluation methods.
  • Engineering leader who thinks about the big picture and can evaluate complex, ambiguous trade-offs to achieve the right outcome(s).
  • Proven experience (8+ years) in software engineering or related roles.
  • Proven experience (5+ years) leading/managing an engineering team, supporting the growth and performance of engineers and managers.
  • Bachelors in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field (otherwise, 11+ years of experience).
  • Extreme proactivity and autonomy in the face of ambiguity, identifying problems and driving solutions to them via themselves as well as others.
  • Deep understanding of the complex technical problems, software development lifecycle, and ensuring reliability and stability of services.
  • Track record of driving clarity via written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills, and organizational skills.
  • Experience resolving complex engineering and communication issues across teams and organizations.
  • Experience in online casino or sports betting products and driving improvements to them.
  • Understanding of ML models and leveraging them to drive product improvement.
  • Supporting a global organization across multiple time zones, with different role types.

About Happening

Happening is the technology engine powering Superbet Group's global platforms and brands that bring thrill to customers across the world every day. We are a game-changing tech company rewriting the rules of sports betting and gaming. We are shaking up the status quo by building our own end-to-end tech stack, solving deep and complex challenges for millions of customers and shaping our culture to work uniquely for the tech community. A true challenger, our technology handles serious scale on par with the Big Techs, and customer obsession runs through every team. Building our own platform gives freedom to innovate and flip the legacy perceptions and industry stereotypes.

Should we talk? Let's do it!

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Remote Work
description:
At BairesDev, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.

Machine Learning Engineer at BairesDev

We are looking for an outstanding Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. This professional will use data and machine learning techniques to help the business automate and scale decision-making, mainly by producing advanced data analysis reports and data-based models to infer and predict patterns.

What You Will Do:

- Help to improve data literacy and the overall analytical environment across the company.
- Handle both structured and unstructured data using SQL and other programming languages.
- Perform advanced data analysis and report results.
- Tell the story behind data in a compelling manner for business people.
- Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms.
- Combine models through ensemble modeling.
- Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges.
- Help to design and execute experiments for hypothesis testing.
- Participate actively in discussions and decisions regarding the whole Machile Learning / Data Science chapter.
- Collaborate with data product managers to build awesome data products.
- Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
- Help to spread a data-driven mindset and to improve data literacy. Be a data evangelist.

Here’s what we are looking for:

- 3+ years of experience with Machine Learning, data science, IA, statistical, and other related areas.
- Proficiency with MySQL.
- Proficiency in Python, R, or another major programming language.
- Excellent communication skills, and capacity to collaborate and build relationships with non-technical users.
- Strong knowledge of probability and statistics, including experimental design, predictive modeling, optimization, and causal inference.
- Hands-on experience with machine learning, like regression classification, clustering, neural networks, feature selection, cross-validation, the curse of dimensionality, bias-variance tradeoff, model explainability, NLP, etc.
Desirable:
- Experience with people analytics or growth.
- Experience with data visualization tools.
- Good understanding of the engineering challenges to deploying machine learning systems to production.

How we make your work (and your life) easier:

  • 100% remote work (from anywhere).
  • Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred
  • Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
  • Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
  • Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
  • Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.
  • Supportive environment with mentorship, promotions, skill development, and diverse growth opportunities.

Join a global team where your unique talents can truly thrive!

title: Global Head of GSI Alliances
description:
Join or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the Global Head of GSI Alliances role at Canonical

19 hours ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Global Head of GSI Alliances role at Canonical

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
We have created a new senior leadership role, Head of Global System Integrator (GSI) Alliances, to lead our business development and partnership with these important actors in the global technology sector. As the publisher of Ubuntu and the leading provider of open source to major technology firms globally, we are expanding into the enterprise market where GSIs provide significant operational and tactical capacity. We have had good success with GSIs that are delivering next-generation private cloud, container, and public cloud solutions built with Canonical Ubuntu, and are looking to expand our investment in these alliances.
Reporting to the VP Global Alliances and Channels, the Global Head of GSI Alliances will lead a team of representatives and develop that strategic go-to-market strength for Canonical. You will work closely with GSI partners throughout their sales cycles and across their sales organizations to make Canonical their trusted partner to deliver opensource solutions at scale for their enterprise customers. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring that our solutions are used or embedded at the core of GSI digital transformation platforms.
Our GSI team builds trusted relationships with partners at executive level, increases Canonical market share and attach rate, evangelizes the partnership and leads all business interactions from engineers to CxO level. The Global Head of GSI Alliances will own the strategy, sell-to, sell-through and sell-with motions with all GSI partners, as well as promotion of our GSI related activities - from campaigns, to strategic opportunities and GSI related events (including Canonical s yearly GSI executive summit).
Location: Our company largely works from home, this role can be based in the Americas or EMEA.
The role entails

  • Own and drive GSI partner strategy, forecast, bookings and revenues for Canonical
  • Lead and evolve a team towards accelerated revenue growth with GSI
  • Build strategic relationships with partners at executive levels
  • Guide our offering from product management, to product marketing, and scale it through the support of our global sales organization
What we are looking for in you:
The successful GSI Alliance Sales Director will have :
  • Experience in alliance and indirect sales management roles
  • Experience in the GSI sector
  • Deep commercial experience encompassing revenue and margins
  • Proven leadership and presentation skills
  • Insight into open source, Ubuntu and Canonical's competition and opportunities
  • Track record of data-driven decision-making
  • An autonomous, disciplined, hands-on, get-it-done mentality
What we offer colleagues
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
We are expanding our in-house legal team, creating an opportunity for an exceptional recent graduate as junior Legal Advisor or junior Legal Counsel. The successful candidate will be a rigorous and effective practitioner with a track record of academic achievement and social engagement. At Canonical they will have the opportunity to work on a variety of transactional matters in the technology and enterprise software realm, as well as the contracts that underpin global employment, contracting and partnerships. In this appointment we are more focused on ability than experience; the position is open to applicants with a relevant degree, but does not have a requirement for extensive work experience. The successful candidate will work closely with our in-house legal team and colleagues worldwide.
Candidates must be able to demonstrate good commercial judgment as well as being organized, efficient, and capable to provide high quality legal and commercial advice. We are looking for a rigorous work ethic, detailed analysis, conscientiousness, and the ambition to identify opportunities for improvement.
Location : This role is home based in Europe, the Middle East, Africa or the Americas, with the option of our London office.
The role entails

  • Report to our global general counsel
  • Draft, review, and negotiate commercial contracts with customers and vendors in many countries across the globe
  • Provide legal support to various internal clients across the company, including Canonical's sales organization
  • Interface with cross-functional teams to support company initiatives
  • Utilize Canonical's contract management system to ensure accurate data is maintained for signed contracts
  • Work with local counsel in many countries to seek and implement advice
What we are looking for in you
  • An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
  • A degree in law, JD or equivalent, and active license to practice law or current progress towards that
  • Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-cultural environment
  • Effective both independently and as part of a team
  • A passion for technology evidenced by personal initiatives and projects
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent drafting and presentation skills
  • Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
  • Appreciative of diversity; polite and effective in a multicultural multinational organization
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
  • Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
  • Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long
Nice-to-have skills
  • Experience in commercial transactions, intellectual property, or corporate law
  • Leadership and the ability to influence others to embrace new ideas or practices
  • Understanding of the open source software community and values
  • Understanding of the technology industry - silicon, data centers, PCs, connected devices, and software
  • Experience working on in-house legal team and/or law firm
What we offer colleagues
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Director of Sales  Latinoamerica - Experience in Hospitality Sales
description:
Job Title: Director of Sales (Latam)

Location: Latin America

Company: Collective Hospitality

About Us:
At Collective Hospitality, we are a global connector fostering bold, authentic experiences through a hybrid of communal and engaging stays, designed for the modern explorer. Our mission is to drive innovative, immersive experiences that resonate with travelers and locals alike. We are seeking a passionate, dynamic Sales Executive to join our team and help build lasting relationships with local accounts while driving revenue growth for the hotels we represent.

Role Overview:

The Regional Sales Leader – LATAM is responsible for driving strategic sales initiatives to boost top-line performance across the region. This includes expanding existing accounts, acquiring new business through local and international promotional activities, and maximizing revenue opportunities for hotel properties. The role also involves leading, mentoring, and developing a high-performing sales team to meet and exceed set targets. The position requires close collaboration with the VP of Operations to ensure sales strategies are aligned with the operational needs of each market.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Identify and pursue new business opportunities to maximize revenue, including local corporate accounts, meetings & events, and group segments.
  2. Represent the brand at local and international trade shows, sales missions, and industry events.
  3. Actively source, qualify, and solicit new leads while reactivating past accounts.
  4. Manage and report monthly KPIs and team performance to the VP of Operations.
  5. Monitor team performance against booking goals; recommend and implement improvement strategies.
  6. Collaborate with Revenue Management to align sales strategies with forecasting and business priorities.
  7. Oversee and optimize the performance of the Groups and Reservations departments, ensuring timely responses, high conversion rates, and effective proposal quality.
  8. Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  9. Conduct client-facing sales activities such as appointments, site visits, re-solicitation calls, “lunch and learns”, social hours, and local CVB-related events.
  10. Guide the Sales team through leadership, mentoring, and regular feedback. Create tailored development plans to support team growth.
  11. Ensure alignment and consistent implementation of global sales strategies throughout the LATAM region.
  12. Maintain full knowledge of all locations, services, packages, and promotions offered by the properties.
  13. Adapt priorities as directed by the VP of Sales, VP of Operations, or evolving business needs.

Qualifications & Requirements

  1. Minimum of 8 years of experience in sales within the hospitality industry, preferably in regional or multi-property roles.
  2. Proven experience managing sales strategies across multiple countries in LATAM.
  3. Advanced proficiency in English and local language (Spanish and/or Portuguese, depending on location).
  4. Strong leadership capabilities with a proven ability to lead and inspire high-performing teams.
  5. Excellent analytical and communication skills, with strong attention to detail.
  6. Passionate about challenges, results-driven, and strategically focused.
  7. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools for data analysis and professional presentations.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Salary: A compensation package that reflects your skills, experience, and the value you bring to the role.
  • Job Stability: Join a dynamic and growing company that values long-term success and career progression.

At Collective Hospitality/ Socialtel , we believe in rewarding talent and fostering a supportive work environment where you can thrive both professionally and personally.

title: Staff Software Development Test Engineer - Work from home
description:
Staff Software Development Test Engineer - Work from home

Staff Software Development Test Engineer - Work from home

2 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Join our close-knit LATAM remote team: Connect through fun activities like coffee breaks, tech talks, and games with your team-mates and management.

Say goodbye to micromanagement! We champion autonomy, open communication, and respect for diversity as our core values.

️Your well-being matters: Our People Care team is here from day one to support you with everything from time-off requests to wellness check-ins.

Plus, our Accounts Management team ensures smooth, effective client relationships, so you can focus on what you do best.

Ready to grow with us?

Here’s what we offer you by joining us!

Competitive USD salary – We value your skills and contributions!

100% remote work – While you can work from anywhere, you’re always welcome to connect with teammates and grow your network at our coworking spaces across LATAM!

Paid time off – Take the time you need according to your country’s regulations, all while receiving your full salary. Rest, recharge, and come back stronger!

National Holidays celebrated – Take time off to celebrate important events and traditions with loved ones, fully embracing your culture.

Sick leave – Focus on your health without the stress. Take the necessary time to recover and feel better.

Refundable Annual Credit – Spend it on the perks you love to enhance your work-life balance!

Team-building activities – Join us for coffee breaks, tech talks, and after-work gatherings to bond with your Nearsure family and feel part of our vibrant community.

Birthday day off – Enjoy an extra day off during your birthday week to celebrate in style with friends and family!

About the project:

As a Staff Software Test Engineer , you will demonstrate expert level skills in test automation tools and strategies as well as a deep and broad understanding of the process of building and deploying software in both cloud and desktop environments. You will use your skills to drive test strategy throughout the testing organization.

How your day-to-day work will look like

  • Recommend improvements to testing processes, technology, and interfaces that improve the effectiveness of testing teams and reduce technical debt.
  • Lead out in quality-related work, training, and mentoring of team members.
  • Evaluate acceptance criteria, determine test approach, write & execute both manual and automated tests as necessary.
  • Own the testing automation strategy, test data management strategy, and test automation for assigned work.
  • Maintain existing test automation frameworks for all existing automated applications.
  • Write, debug, and execute code used in both API and UI automated testing efforts.
  • Define, implement, and manage processes and “best practices” regarding automated testing.
  • Establish processes to continually review and select manual test cases for automation test suite.
  • Provide metrics on business process and code coverage for automated test suites.
  • Present test results to stakeholders.

This would make you the ideal candidate

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 8+ Years of experience working in a QA and Test Automation position.
  • 5+ Years of experience working with C#.
  • 4+ Years of experience working with Selenium.
  • At least 1 year of experience working with Load and performance testing (Jmeter, Blazemeter, etc).
  • Experience working with AWS or Azure with some background in AWS.
  • Experience working with Azure DevOps is a plus.
  • Experience with AI is a plus.
  • Advanced English Level is required for this role as you will work with US clients. Effective communication in English is essential to deliver the best solutions to our clients and expand your horizons.

What to expect from our hiring process

1. Let’s chat about your experience!

2. Impress our recruiters, and you’ll move on to a technical interview with our top developers.

3. Nail that, and you’ll meet our client - your final step to joining our amazing team!

At Nearsure, we’re dedicated to solving complex business challenges through cutting-edge technology and we believe in the power of tailored solutions. Whether you are passionate about transforming businesses with Generative AI, building innovative software products, or implementing comprehensive enterprise platform solutions, we invite you to be part of our dynamic team!

We would love to hear from you if you are eager to make an impact and join a collaborative team that values creativity and expertise.

Let’s work together to shape the future of technology!

title: Consultant
description:
Heidrick & Struggles (Nasdaq: HSII) is the world’s foremost advisor on executive leadership, driving superior client performance through premier human capital leadership advisory services. For more than 70 years, we’ve delivered value for our clients by leveraging unrivaled expertise to help organizations discover and enable outstanding leaders and teams. Learn more at

Job Description:

Heidrick & Struggles is a premier provider of global leadership advisory, serving the senior-level talent and consulting needs of the world's top organizations. In our role as trusted leadership advisors, we partner with our clients to develop future-ready leaders and organizations, bringing together our services and offerings in executive search, diversity and inclusion, leadership assessment and development, organization and team acceleration.

Heidrick Consulting Brazil

You would be part of our Consulting Practice in Brazil. At Heidrick Consulting, we work with Senior Leadership, Executive Teams, and Boards, covering major national and multi-national companies across all industry sectors in Brazil and Latin America.

You will be joining a growing, dynamic team, and in this role as a Consultant, you will continue to learn and deepen your consulting skills by working on various projects. Your contributions will expose you to senior leaders across a variety of industries and geographies.

Primary Responsibilities

The main purpose of the Consultant is to develop consulting solutions as part of client engagements, to write proposals and support business development activities, to act as engagement manager on specific projects and to support Principals and Partners in their delivery.

You will begin to lead, manage, and own problem-solving efforts on a large portion of a client engagement or to lead on smaller engagements. Specifically, you will be responsible for identifying issues, forming hypotheses, designing and conducting analysis, and then synthesizing conclusions into recommendations. Throughout an engagement, you will be involved in discussions and presentations with senior client leadership.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Gathering, analyzing and interpreting data and information; generating insights from analyses.
  • Preparing and presenting information and insights in an impactful and compelling way to help drive client insights and engagement delivery.
  • Delivering a range of consulting solutions, preparing reports and other deliverables that meet client needs.
  • Facilitating and working with client teams with a client first mindset, managing and designing client sessions.
  • Ensuring work is “client ready” (e.g., error free, aligned with expectations, ready to be shared with client) and actively managing expectations with the team.
  • Planning and prioritizing work ensuring team deadlines and quality standards are met.
  • Contributing to proposals (e.g., supporting content development of project design and approaches and case studies) and mobilizing ‘won’ initiatives.
  • Building and sharing reusable, client ready materials, insights (including case studies) and project learnings.
  • Building and maintaining relationships with colleagues across Heidrick & Struggles in Brazil and globally.
  • Contributing to thought leadership and supporting the development of product, tools, and methodologies.
  • Involving yourself in internal initiatives, supporting ongoing improvements of business and employee experience; many initiatives are global and will provide an opportunity to build a global network.

The Ideal Candidate:

Passionate and Engaged: Will bring a genuine enthusiasm for serving a broad variety of organizations on strategic people and talent topics, including leadership and team development, succession planning, Board effectiveness and organizational culture change.

Self-Driven and Inquisitive: Exhibits a strong desire to continuously learn and explore new topics relevant to client organizations and industry sectors.

Entrepreneurial Spirit and Team Player: Possesses an entrepreneurial mindset with a keen interest in contributing to a growing business unit. Brings innovative ideas and a proactive approach to delivering on agreed deadlines and client deliverables.

Minimum Role Qualifications

  • 2-4 years of professional work experience, with a minimum of 2 years in a management, strategy or leadership consulting environment.
  • An undergraduate degree is required.
  • Experience working directly with clients in a professional service, team-based environment.
  • Ability to drive workload independently within a broader team project setting.
  • Ability to manage time effectively, being comfortable with handling multiple priorities and being able to adapt to changing business needs.
  • Demonstrated advanced proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and Word; easily able to adopt new technologies and software.
  • Excellent communication skills; writing skills with a proven track record of success preparing concise and compelling reports and other client ready deliverables.
  • Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing, in English and Portuguese. Other languages are a plus.
  • Willingness to travel locally and globally as required.

Heidrick & Struggles is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring qualified protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, or citizenship status.

Heidrick & Struggles is committed to providing reasonable accommodations and/or adjustments during our recruitment process. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation and/or adjustment, please inform your Talent Acquisition professional.

title: Geofísico
description:
Procuramos as pessoas certas - pessoas que queiram inovar, crescer e liderar. Atraímos e retemos os melhores talentos, investindo em nossos funcionários e capacitando-os para que se desenvolvam e desenvolvam suas carreiras. Esta oportunidade também está disponível para pessoas com deficiências (PCD’s).

Job Duties and Qualifications

Requisitos

  • Graduação em Geofísica ou Geologia, com preferência para candidatos com Mestrado aplicado.
  • Inglês avançado
  • Excelência em comunicação interpessoal e proatividade.
  • Conhecimento em fluxos de interpretação sísmica, amarração de poços, modelagem de velocidade e modelagem estrutural.
  • Conhecimento de softwares de interpretação geofísica e integração de dados.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma integrada com equipes multidisciplinares, especialmente em projetos de geociências.

Responsabilidades

  • Realizar fluxos de amarração de poços e integração de dados sísmicos com dados de poços para garantir correlações precisas, modelagem de velocidade e modelagem estrutural.
  • Realizar fluxos de interpretação sísmica, incluindo, análise e interpretação de dados sísmicos para identificar estruturas geológicas e delinear reservatórios.
  • Analisar e interpretar atributos sísmicos para melhorar a compreensão da geologia do reservatórios e identificar áreas de interesse.
  • Suportar usuários no desenvolvimento e utilização de fluxos de trabalho geofísicos em ferramentas de interpretação.
  • Elaborar materiais de treinamento (PowerPoint, vídeos) e liderar sessões de capacitação sobre fluxos de trabalho e técnicas geofísicas.
  • Esclarecer dúvidas técnicas relacionadas às ferramentas de geofísica e seus resultados.
  • Realizar testes e validações de novas versões dos softwares utilizados (homologação), garantindo que as ferramentas atendam aos requisitos geofísicos.
  • Interagir com equipes multidisciplinares, fornecendo suporte técnico em geofísica para outros profissionais, como geólogos e engenheiros.
  • Liderar iniciativas de desenvolvimento de melhorias e plug-ins em softwares de interpretação geofísica, colaborando com clientes e equipes internas.

description:
Software Engineering Manager - Sustaining Engineering
